questions.question: What is iStart Internship Program?
questions.answer: The Government provides internship opportunities to Startups registered under i-Start by collaborating with companies in various sectors. A stipend of up to INR 20,000 per Startup member (subject to INR 1 Lakh) is provided during the internship.

questions.question: What is iStart Spotlight?
questions.answer: iStart Spotlight involves capacity-building activities across districts, offering training on operations, human resources, marketing, and promotion.

questions.question: To whom additional booster is provided?
questions.answer: Additional boosters are given for employment generation, product-based startups, and startups founded by women, transgender, and SC-ST founders.

questions.question: How much additional fund will be provided for Women Startup?
questions.answer: Startups with more than 50% equity held by women founders will receive an additional INR 60,000.

questions.question: Is Scale up a Fund or Loan?
questions.answer: The Scale-up Fund provides financial support as debt convertible to a grant.

questions.question: How much additional amount can be availed in Viability Grant?
questions.answer: Startups that upgrade their Q-Rate score within the defined period can receive additional grants.

questions.question: Is the additional booster applicable for both fund types?
questions.answer: The booster applies to either the Viability Grant or the Scale-up Fund.

questions.question: How much additional booster is available for Product-Based Startups?
questions.answer: Product-based startups can receive a 10% booster on Viability Grant and Scale-up Fund.

questions.question: Who is eligible for the program?
questions.answer: Students currently studying in classes 8th to 12th across registered schools in Rajasthan.

questions.question: I don't have a startup yet. Should I still enroll?
questions.answer: Yes, there are two tracks: one for aspiring founders and one for active founders.

questions.question: Who has access to the Learning Management System?
questions.answer: Students registered on the platform have access to content in both Hindi and English.

questions.question: Is there a cost to the program?
questions.answer: The program is completely free and only requires internet access.

questions.question: Is there a limit to the number of founders who can participate?
questions.answer: No, there is no limit on the number of participants.

questions.question: How many hours should I expect to put into this?
questions.answer: The program is flexible, allowing students to spend as much time as they want.

questions.question: If I’m already doing a startup, why should I bother with this?
questions.answer: The program offers insights on best practices and provides access to mentors and resources.

questions.question: If I’m working with other people, who should participate?
questions.answer: Co-founders should participate, with one team leader representing the group.

questions.question: Is it mandatory for mentor teachers to undergo training?
questions.answer: Yes, mentor teachers must undergo entrepreneurship training.

questions.question: What kind of training is provided to mentor teachers?
questions.answer: Rigorous training on entrepreneurship development is provided.

questions.question: What is the role of a mentor teacher?
questions.answer: Mentor teachers act as an interface between the iStart team and schools, mentoring teachers and students on entrepreneurship development.

questions.question: What are the day-to-day tasks assigned to mentor teachers?
questions.answer: They mentor teams on business ideas, address student doubts, and manage capacity-building programs.

questions.question: Will mentor teachers be given certification for course training?
questions.answer: Yes, certificates are awarded after completing assignments and quizzes with a 60% pass rate.

questions.question: How will mentor teachers be assessed?
questions.answer: Assessment is done through an assessment panel.

questions.question: What is the team size to be handled by mentor teachers?
questions.answer: They are responsible for at least 30 student teams.

questions.question: Would mentor teachers receive a stipend?
questions.answer: Yes, up to INR 10,000 per month based on KPIs.

questions.question: What is QRate?
questions.answer: QRate is an assessment program that evaluates a startup's strengths and investment-worthiness.

questions.question: What does the QRate assessment include?
questions.answer: It includes a Startup Scorecard, skill-building programs, and Investor Connect.

questions.question: How can I apply for QRate?
questions.answer: Register on the iStart portal and submit your business plan.

questions.question: What parameters are used to assess startups in QRate?
questions.answer: Parameters include product, revenue streams, market potential, and customer management.

questions.question: What is the QRate Scorecard?
questions.answer: A report assessing the startup’s strengths and weaknesses across business parameters.

questions.question: How long does it take to receive QRate assessment results?
questions.answer: Results are provided within 15 working days of submission.

questions.question: Can I reapply for QRate?
questions.answer: Yes, startups can apply for re-evaluation after the initial assessment.

questions.question: What is Investor Connect?
questions.answer: It connects startups with venture capitalists and investors for funding opportunities.
